intro: Cyrtorchis refracta, commonly known as the refracta orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, narrow leaves and striking, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Cyrtorchis refracta is known for its short blooming period, usually occurring in spring, and requires specific conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
